description: Chelsea failed in their attempts to sign Napoli defender Kalidou Koulibaly for one specific reason, the president of the Italian club has revealed. The Blues tabled a huge offer.
title: Chelsea news: Why £47m bid for Kalidou Koulibaly failed
title_page: Chelsea news: Why £47m bid for Kalidou Koulibaly failed | Daily Mail Online
text:
Chelsea failed in their attempts to sign Napoli defender Kalidou Koulibaly for one specific reason.
Aurelio De Laurentiis, Napoli president, admits the Blues tabled a huge offer for the versatile 25-year-old defender.
A sum of €55 million (£47m) was rejected by the Serie A side for Koulibaly, with De Laurentiis admitting the club simply could not go through with the deal due to a lack of reinforcements.
Napoli's president has revealed why he turned down Chelsea's £47m bid for Kalidou Koulibaly
'Chelsea had offered €55m, but I told Conte that I could not give him up without first having a worthy substitute,' De Laurentiis said in an interview with beIN Sports.
'[I will not sell him] unless Sarri (Napoli manager) tells me: "I have Tom, Dick and Harry who are reliable: you give up who you want",' he added.
Knocked back by Napoli, Chelsea instead plumped for David Luiz in a last-gasp summer transfer window deal.
The Brazilian has enjoyed great success during his return to Stamford Bridge this season, though the agent of Koulibaly still maintains his man could potentially seal a move to West London.
The tough-tackling defender has made himself a top target of Europe's elite teams
Blues boss Antonio Conte brought back Brazilian David Luiz after his Koulibaly bid failed
Speaking to a local Naples radio station, Kiss Kiss Napoli, the defender's agent Bruno Satin said: 'Chelsea were interested but then they signed David Luiz and you also have John Terry and Gary Cahill at the club so there is a lot of competition there.
'We will see what happens. A lot of the improvements that Koulibaly has made in his game have been down to the coaching of Maurizio Sarri.
'Whatever happens in the future will depend on the president and whether or not he decides to evaluate any offers that may come in,' he added.
Koulibaly's current deal with Napoli is set to run until 2021
